page.title: 10Farming in Pebworth (l)
page.content: In Pebworth and Long Marston the l5 farms (mainly tenancies) range from 80 - 300 acres. Crabtree, Pettifers, Baldwins, Court, Bridge, Little Meadows are mainly dairy, Manor Farm raises sheep, Rookery and Low Furrow sheep and beef cattle. Middlesex, Priory Hill, New Buildings, Jordans and Goodwins combine arable (wheat, barley, oats) and pasture. The farms cover approx.2500 acres. Animals are sold at general livestock markets (Banbury, Gloucester,Stratford) and at Honeybourne yearly lamb sale. Corn merchants sell to mills e.g flour/ animal feed stuff and to the government ( E.E.C. intervention policy). Increased mechanisation means manpower has been drastically cut and rural communities are concerned about chemical crop spraying and autumn stubble burning.
